headline: AppLovin (NasdaqGS:APP) Welcomes Maynard Webb to Board as Edward Oberwager Steps Down
summary: AppLovin (NasdaqGS:APP) experienced a 15% price increase over the last month, amidst significant executive changes and merger discussions. The appointment of Maynard Webb to the board likely bolstered investor confidence in the company's governance. Meanwhile, the announcement of a potential bid for TikTok's non-Chinese assets positioned AppLovin as a contender in the global advertising space. Despite these positive movements, the broader market faced downturns, with the Nasdaq dropping 6%...

headline: AppLovin Stock Is a Buy. ‘Ad Tech’s Best Executor’ Is on Sale.
summary: AppLovin  stock has been on a wild ride, but  Morgan Stanley  says now is the time to buy shares in what it called a resilient advertising company.  Analyst Matthew Cost upgraded shares of AppLovin to Overweight from Equal-Weight on Thursday.  Shares of  AppLovin  were down 5.4% Thursday to $260.22.

headline: AppLovin, Levi Strauss get upgrades
summary: Shares of both AppLovin and Levi Strauss received Wall Street upgrades. AppLovin (APP) had its rating raised to Overweight from Equal Weight at Morgan Stanley. Levi Strauss's (LEVI) rating was raised to Buy at BofA Securities. Learn more about both calls in the video above. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: Morgan Stanley upgrades AppLovin, sees 27% upside on strong ad growth potential
summary: Investing.com -- Morgan Stanley upgraded AppLovin (NASDAQ:APP) Corp to “Overweight” from “Equal-weight,” citing strong execution, expanding market share in in-app advertising, and a favorable risk-reward setup. The brokerage has a new price target of $350, implying 27% upside from current levels.
